metadata.name: Dwarka
metadata.description:
The letters in the bottles, and the faith of those who wrote them,  
Waves come and go, yet the moon and Sun are always the same,  
Cheers for the ones I didn't drink to find and share Light Under Waterâ€¦

Inspired by the ancient city of Dwarka, one of the seven holy pilgrimage centres in India, part of this archeological and architectural wonder is said to have sunk beneath the Arabian Sea.

This piece represents rebirth, evokes times and places where we find hope and renewal within ourselves. Even in the darkest or most challenging of times, there is light around us, helping to uncover the potential that lies within us. 


Music Made in 432 Hz  
Prod. By Yoshiro Mare
